page.title: 13Annual Sheep Shearing
page.content: Ystradowen and Pendoylan District Sheep Shearing Society, in conjunction with Maendy and District, held their 74th sheep shearing competition on Wednesday 5th June 1985 at Cowbridge cattle market. The judges were Mr.K. Watkins, Mr.T. Bradley, Mr.V.E. Samuel and Mr.G. Thomas. There were eleven classes, one hundred and forty sheep to be sheared and forty four entrants. The entrants came from places such as the Vale, Bridgend, Margam, Maesteg, Raglan and Abergavenny. Various people and newspapers had cups or shields named after them. These cups were presented to the winners (1) For the best shorn sheep in the match.(2) Speed and action. Class 1 was to shear three sheep and tie fleeces in 25 minutes. Class 2 to shear two sheep and tie fleeces in 25 minutes, these competitors to be under 20 years old.
